intro: Caucalis sanicula, commonly known as lesser sanicle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, slightly peppery scent. Caucalis sanicula is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, white or greenish-white flowers in early summer.
